                           throws IOException,
                                  CompressionUtil.UnsupportedCompressionType
        Tries to decompress a file into a newly created temporary directory, trying gzip or zip regardless of the filename or its suffix.
        Returns:
        folder containing all decompressed files
        Throws:
        IOException
        CompressionUtil.UnsupportedCompressionType

      • decompressFile

        public static List<File> decompressFile(File directory,
                                        File compressedFile,
                                        boolean keepSubdirectories)
                                 throws IOException,
                                        CompressionUtil.UnsupportedCompressionType
        Tries to decompress a file trying gzip or zip regardless of the filename or its suffix.
        Parameters:
        directory - directory where archive's contents will be decompressed to
        compressedFile - compressed file
        Returns:
        list of files that have been extracted or null an empty list if archive couldn't be decompressed
        Throws:
        IOException - if problem occurred reading compressed file, or directory couldn't be written to
        CompressionUtil.UnsupportedCompressionType - if the compression type wasn't recognized

      • ungzipFile

        public static List<File> ungzipFile(File directory,
                                    File zipFile)
                             throws IOException
        Extracts a gzipped file. Subdirectories or hidden files (i.e. files starting with a dot) are being ignored.
        Parameters:
        directory - where the file should be extracted to
        zipFile - to extract
        Returns:
        a list of all created files
        Throws:
        IOException

      • ungzipFile

        public static List<File> ungzipFile(File directory,
                                    File zipFile,
                                    boolean isTarred)
                             throws IOException
        Gunzip a file. Use this method with isTarred false if the gzip contains a single file. If it's a gzip of a tar archive pass true to isTarred (or call @ungzipFile(directory, zipFile) which is what this method just redirects to for isTarred).
        Parameters:
        directory - the output directory for the uncompressed file(s)
        zipFile - the gzip file
        isTarred - true if the gzip contains a tar archive
        Returns:
        a List of the uncompressed file name(s)
        Throws:
        IOException - if reading or writing fails

      • unzipFile

        public static List<File> unzipFile(File directory,
                                   File zipFile)
                            throws IOException
        Defaults keepSubdirectories to false.
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        unzipFile(java.io.File, java.io.File, boolean)

      • zipDir

        public static void zipDir(File dir,
                          File zipFile)
                   throws IOException
        Zip a directory with all files but skipping included subdirectories. Only files directly within the directory are added to the archive.
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory to zip
        zipFile - the zipped file
        Throws:
        IOException

      • zipDir

        public static void zipDir(File dir,
                          File zipFile,
                          boolean inclSubdirs)
                   throws IOException
        Zip a directory with all files. Files in Subdirectories will be included if the inclSubdirs is true.
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory to zip
        zipFile - the zipped file
        inclSubdirs - if true includes all subdirectories recursively
        Throws:
        IOException

      • zipFile

        public static void zipFile(File file,
                           File zipFile)
                    throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • zipFiles

        public static void zipFiles(Collection<File> files,
                            File rootContext,
                            File zipFile)
                     throws IOException
        Creates a zip archive from a given collection of files. In order to preserve paths in the archive a rootContext can be specified which will be removed from the individual zip entries. For example a rootContext of /home/freak with a file /home/freak/photo/birthday.jpg to be zipped will result in a zip entry with a path photo/birthday.jpg.
        Parameters:
        files - to be included in the zip archive
        rootContext - optional path to be removed from each file
        zipFile - the zip file to be created
        Throws:
        IOException

      • unzipFile

        public static List<File> unzipFile(File directory,
                                   File zipFile,
                                   boolean keepSubdirectories)
                            throws IOException
        Extracts a zipped file into a target directory. If the file is wrapped in a root directory, this is removed by default. Other subdirectories are ignored according to the parameter keepSubdirectories.
        The following types of files are also ignored by default: i) hidden files (i.e. files starting with a dot) ii) Apple resource fork (__MACOSX), including its subdirectories and subfiles
        Parameters:
        directory - where the zipped file and its subdirectories should be extracted to
        zipFile - to extract
        keepSubdirectories - whether to preserve subdirectories or not
        Returns:
        a list of all created files and directories extracted to target directory
        Throws:
        IOException
